SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: KNIGHT'S TRUST, MEDIA AND DEMOCRACY:AS PART OF KNIGHT'S TRUST, MEDIA AND DEMOCRACY INITIATIVE TO EXPLORE THE ROLE OF TRUST IN JOURNALISM IN OUR DEMOCRACY, THIS WORK INCLUDED SIGNIFICANT OPINION RESEARCH AND SURVEYS CONDUCTED BY INDEPENDENT THIRD-PARTY FIRMS THAT WERE PUBLICLY DISSEMINATED. THESE SURVEYS EXPLORED MEDIA ATTITUDES AS WELL AS WAYS TO BUILD TRUST IN INFORMATION.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: KNIGHT MEDIA FORUM:THE KNIGHT MEDIA FORUM IS THE PREMIER GATHERING FOR FUNDERS AND MEDIA LEADERS WORKING TO STRENGTHEN LOCAL NEWS, COMMUNITY AND DEMOCRACY. THE CONVENING HAS EVOLVED OVER THE PAST TWELVE YEARS TO A SIX HUNDRED PERSON CONFERENCE WHICH INCLUDES LEARNING EVENTS WITH EXPERTS AND LEADING PRACTITIONERS IN THESE AREAS. PARTICIPANTS LEAVE WITH I) AWARENESS OF CUTTING-EDGE ISSUES AND MAJOR TRENDS IN COMMUNITY NEWS AND INFORMATION, II) PRACTICAL TOOLS AND REPLICABLE IDEAS AND III) NEW PARTNERSHIPS AND RELATIONSHIPS TO HELP EXECUTE PROJECTS.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS:IN 2018, THE KNIGHT COMMISSION ON INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS CONTINUED ITS WORK IN DEVELOPING AND SUPPORTING REFORMS THAT SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN THE EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF COLLEGE SPORTS. THE COMMISSION HELD TWO PUBLIC MEETINGS IN WASHINGTON, D.C. TO DISCUSS HIGH-PROFILE ISSUES AND PROPOSED REFORMS WITH COLLEGE SPORTS LEADERS. SEVERAL OF THE RESULTING RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE COMMISSION WERE ADOPTED BY THE NCAA. ADDITIONALLY, THE COMMISSION REVAMPED ITS COLLEGE ATHLETICS FINANCIAL INFORMATION DATABASE (CAFI DATABASE), WHICH IS AN AUTHORITATIVE SOURCE FOR UNDERSTANDING COLLEGE SPORTS FINANCES.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: ON THE TABLE:THE ON THE TABLE INITIATIVE AT KNIGHT FOUNDATION WAS LAUNCHED IN 2016 AND CONVENES THOUSANDS OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN ELEVEN KNIGHT CITIES TO SHARE BOTH A MEAL AND IDEAS ON HOW TO MAKE THEIR CITY A BETTER PLACE TO LIVE AND WORK WITH SOLUTIONS-ORIENTED CONVERSATIONS. THOUSANDS OF PARTICIPANTS' SURVEYS ARE COLLECTED, ANALYZED AND SHARED WITH DECISIONMAKERS OF EACH COMMUNITY. STRATEGIC SUPPORT IS PROVIDED FOR EACH OF THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS LEADING THE ON THE TABLE SESSIONS IN THEIR CITY.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: LAB305, LLC:LOCATED IN A HISTORICALLY UNDERINVESTED COMMUNITY, LAB 305 CONNECTS MIAMI'S EMERGING ENTREPRENEURS WITH THE CORPORATE COMMUNITY THROUGH EVENTS, EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND OTHER ACTIVITIES THAT SPUR INNOVATION AND HELP LAUNCH AND SCALE NEW IDEAS.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: NEWSGUARD TECHNOLOGIES: TO COMBAT MISINFORMATION AND DISINFORMATION BY HIRING TRAINED JOURNALISTS TO PRODUCE RELIABILITY INDICATORSFOR WEBSITES AND VIDEO CHANNELS THAT DRIVE MOST OF THE NEWS ENGAGEMENT IN THE U.S. SO THAT READERS CAN BE BETTER EDUCATED ABOUT THE ISSUES THEY CARE ABOUT.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: APPLICATIONS FOR FUNDING ARE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY VIA THE FOUNDATION WEBSITE. PLEASE GO TO WWW.KF.ORG TO APPLY FOR A GRANT. FOR JOURNALISM, COMMUNITIES, NATIONAL AND ARTS PROGRAMS, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION IN OUR ONLINE FORM: TELL US ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY PRESENTED BY YOUR IDEA/PROJECT, WHAT IT WILL TRANSFORM, AND THE IMPACT IT WILL HAVE. HOW WILL IT CREATE LASTING, VISIBLE CHANGE? TELL US HOW YOU INDENTIFIED THIS OPPORTUNITY AND WHY THE TIME IS RIGHT FOR IT. WHAT OTHER PARTNERS OR FUNDERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE IDEA/PROJECT? HOW WILL YOU MEASURE SUCCESS? HOW ARE YOU UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT? PLEASE DESCRIBE ORGANIZATIONAL AND FINANCIAL CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT YOUR IDEA/PROJECT INCLUDING ANY BUSINESS PLAN. HOW WILL YOUR IDEA/PROJECT BE SUSTAINED BEYOND KNIGHT FOUNDATION'S FUNDING?
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.SubmissionDeadlinesTxt: WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SPECIAL INITIATIVES AND CONTESTS, THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE DEADLINES.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: ANY RESTRICTIONS OR LIMITATIONS ON AWARDS, SUCH AS BY GEOGRAPHICAL AREAS, CHARITABLE FIELDS, KIND OF INSTITUTIONS OR OTHER FACTORS: -MEDICAL RESEARCH, ORGANIZATIONS OR PROJECTS WHOSE MISSION IS TO PREVENT, ERADICATE AND/OR ALLEVIATE THE EFFECTS OF A SPECIFIC DISEASE -POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS AND LEGISLATIVE LOBBYING EFFORTS -PROJECTS THAT EXCLUSIVELY SERVE RELIGIOUS PURPOSES -DIRECT SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS
